item.description:
For our first kayak trip of the season, we’ll launch at the mouth of Portsmouth Harbor - on the Maine side in Kittery Point. The launch point has tremendous views of ocean, lighthouses, sailboats, islands and forts.  It's probably my favorite place in the Seacoast.

Meet @ 11 am  and explore the harbor and surrounding areas.  Figure about 3 to 4 hours of paddling if the weather is nice.  Bring a snack and we can also get something to eat afterward.

Tide: High tide is 9:30 am but I'm guessing some of you will want to sleep a bit later so we'll meet at 11am.

Weather:  It should be a warm, sunny day - high 70s at least!  But regardless of the weather, the water is still cold and very unpleasant should you get wet.  The cold water inhibits your ability to swim so everyone must wear a life jacket (PFD).

Boats: Please contact me if you need a boat or have one to share.

Directions From Route 1 in Maine, follow Route 103 east to Kittery Point (Whipple and Pepperrell Rds). A mile or two after you go over a bridge, look for Frisbee's Market on your right. The town pier is located directly behind this quaint, historic market

Parking: There is limited parking at the docks and the town of Kittery is now charging a small fee. If no space is available, park in Frisbee's lot across the street. They sometimes charge a few dollars but sometimes allow free parking for customers. Hint: they have a nice selection of fine wines... But definitely let them know you're parking there while kayaking.

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgement.  As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. 

If you're inclined, you may also agree to buy the organizer a beer after the event if you had a good time!
item.name: Kittery Point Kayak!
